properties.Name: ExperianCompanyOperatingStatement
properties.Description: Operating Statement information provided by Standard and Poor.

Columns.Name: ExperianFileNumber
Columns.Description: The unique and persistent number that identifies and tracks the Experian company.

Columns.Name: ProfileTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp of the Experian profile.

Columns.Name: FiscalYear
Columns.Description: The fiscal year of the data reported.

Columns.Name: EndingDate
Columns.Description: The ending date of the fiscal year.

Columns.Name: NetSalesAmount
Columns.Description: Net sales are the amount of sales generated by a company after the deduction of returns, allowances for damaged or missing goods and any discounts allowed.

Columns.Name: CostOfGoodSoldAmount
Columns.Description: Cost of goods sold (COGS) are the direct costs attributable to the production of the goods sold by a company.

Columns.Name: GrossIncomeOnSalesAmount
Columns.Description: A company's revenue minus cost of goods sold. Also called gross profit and, when it is expressed as a percentage of revenue, gross margin.

Columns.Name: ExpensesAmount
Columns.Description: 'Business Expenses' Any expenses incurred in the ordinary course of business. Business expenses are deductible and are always netted against business income.

Columns.Name: PreTaxIncomeAmount
Columns.Description: Pretax earnings are a company's earnings after all operating expenses, including interest and depreciation, have been deducted from total sales or revenues, but before income taxes have been subtracted.

Columns.Name: AfterTaxIncomeAmount
Columns.Description: After-tax income is the amount of money that a company has left over after all federal, state and withholding taxes have been deducted from taxable income.

Columns.Name: ExtraordinaryIncomeAmount
Columns.Description: An extraordinary item consists of gains or losses included on a company's income statement from events, which are unusual and infrequent in nature

Columns.Name: DiscontinuedOperationsAmount
Columns.Description: A discontinued operation occurs when a segment or certain product line in a company's business has been sold, disposed of or abandoned and is subsequently reported on the company's income statement as income separate from continued operations.

Columns.Name: NetIncomeAmount
Columns.Description: Net income (NI) is a company's total earnings (or profit); net income is calculated by taking revenues and subtracting the costs of doing business such as depreciation, interest, taxes and other expenses.
